explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_solids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data, though classified as flammable according to ICSC (2003)

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Considered non-pyrophoric when in contact with air at ordinary temperatures since the substance is stable to heat (up to 150degC) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data)

self_heating_substances.rationale: Stable to heat (up to 150degC) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data)

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Organic compounds containing chlorine and oxygen (but not fluorine), with the chlorine and oxygen bound to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements)

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances with melting point of >55degC are not available (melting point:72.4degC (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data)).

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of 578mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (2005)).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (dermal route) value of >5,000mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (2005)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is a solid according to the GHS criteria and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Based on the rat LC50 (inhalation route) value of >5.0mg/L (4 hours), together with the absence of mortality (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (2005)).

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the evidence of only mild irritation with the maximum Draize score of 0.8, which cleared up on day 3, observed in rabbit skin irritation tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (2005)).

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the evidence of irritant effects on the cornea, iris and conjunctiva, which persisted for at least 21 days of observation (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (2005)).

germ_cell_mutagenicity.hazard_statement: May cause an allergic skin reaction
germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on positive results in guinea pig skin sensitization tests employing the Buehler method (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1993)).

carcinogenicity.rationale: Based on negative data in in vitro reverse mutation tests and rat in vivo chromosome aberration tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (2005)).

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is classified as Category C by IARC (1987).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on no evidence of adverse effects on reproduction or offspring development observed in rat 2-generation reproduction studies and rat/rabbit teratogenicity studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (2005)).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs (nervous system)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies including "inanimation," "ataxia," "collapse," "lacrimation," and "salivation" (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (2005)). These effects were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2.

aspiration_hazard.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
aspiration_hazard.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (thyroid) May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (liver, kidney, adrenal gland)
aspiration_hazard.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies including "increased incidence of hypertrophy of the thyroid follicular epithelium," "hepatocellular hypertrophy, hepatocellular necrosis/vacuolization," "reduced kidney weight and centrilobular hepatocellular hypertrophy, and dilatation/degeneration of the renal cortical tubules," and "hypertrophy of the adrenal cortical cells" (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (2005)). These effects were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 1 (thyroid gland) and Category 2 (liver, kidneys, adrenal).

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 48 hours EC50=0.096mg/L of the crustacea (Daphnia magna) (MOE eco-toxicity tests of chemicals, 1998).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since the acute toxicity was Category 1 and it had no rapidly degrading (the decomposition by BOD: 0% (Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)), and it had the bio-accumulation (BCF=10000 (Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)), it was classified into Category 1.
